TunableList.name: _elements
TunableList.description: The list of elements in the dynamic enumeration.

Tunable.name: ATTRACTION_BONUS
Tunable.description: The distance, in meters, the Sim will go out of their way to choose objects near other Sims. This bonus will drop off as distance from other Sims increases.

TunableList.name: DISTANCE_TO_IMPACT_CURVE
TunableList.description: Tunable curve where the X-axis defines the distance between the goal and the target while the y axis corresponds at the impact multiplier that will affect how much of the relationship affinity should affect the scoring of the goal. Example: If the sims are at a close distance less than 2 meters, we want to tune the curve to be 1 from 0 to 2 meters, this way the impact of the relationship will not make the sims reposition if they are already close to each other. Then after two meters we want to start decaying how much impact the relationship should affect, so setting 0 impact on the y axis at a distance of 10 meters will create a linear decay where after 10 meters the relationship will not affect the goal scoring.

Tunable.name: AVOID_PENALTY
Tunable.description: The effective increased distance, in meters, the Sim will consider objects nearby other Sims. This penalty will drop off as distance from other Sims increases.

Tunable.name: ADJACENT_TO_GROUP_MEMBER_BONUS
Tunable.description: Add this bonus, in meters, if the object is a part and there is an adjacent part in use by a group member.

Tunable.name: AUTONOMOUSLY_PREFERRED_BONUS
Tunable.description: Add this bonus, in meters, if the interaction prefers that this target is selected. This uses autonomy preferences to help figure out where a Sim should go to. Example: When sims choose to use a bed they prefer to use their own bed. When Sims do a posture transition to do WooHoo, they should also use their bed. This value determines how far out of the way the Sim will go to meet that preference.

Tunable.name: BEST_OBJECT_BONUS
Tunable.description: On the first route, we prefer parts on the object that contains the part that you clicked over other objects or parts. Sims will go this many meters out of their way to get to that object.

Tunable.name: BEST_PART_BONUS
Tunable.description: Sims will go this many meters out of their way to get to the part picked when choosing the interaction. This should be slightly larger than the radius of our largest multi-part object. This bonus is applied in addition to the best object bonus.

Tunable.name: CARRYING_SIM_BUSY_PENALTY
Tunable.description: The penalty to apply to Sims running guaranteed SIs. The cost of being carried by a Sim is the product of their number of guaranteed SIs and this value.

Tunable.name: CARRYING_SIM_HAS_NOT_MET_PENALTY
Tunable.display: Carrying Sim Has Not Met Penalty
Tunable.description: The penalty to apply to Sims that are not met when attempting to transition into a 'Be Carried' posture targeting them.

Tunable.name: CARRYING_SIM_NON_CAREGIVER_PENALTY
Tunable.description: The penalty to apply to Sims that are not a Sim's caregiver when attempting to transition into a 'Be Carried' posture targeting them.

Tunable.name: CARRYING_SIM_NOT_IN_ENSEMBLE_PENALTY
Tunable.display: Carrying Sim Not In Ensemble Penalty
Tunable.description: The penalty to apply to Sims that are not in an ensemble with the Sim, if the Sim is in an ensemble, when attempting to transition into a 'Be Carried' posture targeting them.

Tunable.name: DEST_ALREADY_SELECTED_PENALTY
Tunable.description: Add this penalty, in meters, if a transition sequence already picked this destination.

Tunable.name: ENSEMBLE_BONUS
Tunable.description: The distance, in meters, the Sim will go out of their way to choose objects near other Sims in their ensemble. This bonus will drop off as distance from other Sims increases.

Tunable.name: ENTER_EXIT_OBJECT_COST
Tunable.description: Cost for entering or exiting an object.

Tunable.name: HAS_NOT_MET_PENALTY
Tunable.description: The effective increased distance, in meters, the Sim will consider objects nearby Sims they have met. This penalty will drop off as distance from other Sims increases.

Tunable.name: IN_PARTY_CONSTRAINT_BONUS
Tunable.description: Add this bonus, in meters, if the object is within the Sim's party's constraint.

Tunable.name: IN_USE_PENALTY
Tunable.description: The Penalty, in meters, to apply if the part is already in use. Keep this greater than Not Best Part Penalty so sims will still try a new part if the best part fails.

Tunable.name: INNER_NON_MOBILE_TO_NON_MOBILE_COINCIDENT_COST
Tunable.display: Inner Non Mobile To Non Mobile Coincident Cost
Tunable.description: This cost is applied to transitions between parts of the same object, as long as those parts are coincident, i.e. have identical physical locations. Ideally, this cost is less than the cost of exiting the part and then re-entering the same part from stand. e.g. Transitioning from the middle cushion of the sofa, facing left, to the same cushion, but facing right.

Tunable.name: INNER_NON_MOBILE_TO_NON_MOBILE_COST
Tunable.display: Inner Non Mobile To Non Mobile Cost
Tunable.description: This cost is applied to transitions between parts of the same object. This cost is only applied when the parts are not coincident, i.e. are in different physical locations. e.g. Scooting from the left cushion of the loveseat to the right cushion.

Tunable.name: MIN_INNER_NON_MOBILE_TO_NON_MOBILE_COST
Tunable.display: Min Inner Non Mobile To Non Mobile Cost
Tunable.description: The minimum cost of transition between parts of the same object. This value will be used if the transition cost after calculation is zero or negative.

Tunable.name: OBJECT_RESERVED_PENALTY
Tunable.description: The Penalty, in meters, to apply if another Sim has already started a transition to use an object a Sim is considering.

Tunable.name: PREFERRED_POSTURE_TARGET_BONUS
Tunable.description: Add this bonus if the target of the posture is a preferred target. For example, when calling to meal on a table, all seats of the table should be preferred over any other sit on the house no.

Tunable.name: SAME_CLUSTER_SIM_MULTIPLIER
Tunable.description: This multiplier is applied to the bonus for Sims in the same cluster as the object being considered by the Sim. Raising this will encourage Sims to join/avoid clusters with people they like/dislike.

Tunable.name: SURFACE_BONUS
Tunable.description: Add this bonus, in meters, to surface nodes if we prefer surface for the interaction.
